org.jacktheclipper.frontend.controller

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.controller.UserController

  • @Controller
 @PreAuthorize(value="hasRole(\'ROLE_USER\')")
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all requests where a user does not want to edit anything. It basically shows a user a selected feed

    • Method Detail

      • showFeedOverview

        @GetMapping(value="/*/feed")
public java.lang.String showFeedOverview(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth,
                                                                       @RequestParam(value="feedId",required=false)
                                                                       java.util.UUID feedId,
                                                                       org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                                                       @RequestParam(value="page",required=false)
                                                                       java.lang.Integer page,
                                                                       @RequestParam(value="showArchived",required=false)
                                                                       java.lang.Boolean showArchived,
                                                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Shows a user all articles of a requested feed. Defaults to the first found feed if no feedId is specified
        Parameters:
        auth - The user wanting to see a feed
        feedId - The id of the requested feed. This parameter is optional. If present, the articles matching the criteria of the feed with the selected feed are shown
        model -
        page - Articles belonging to a feed are paginated. This optional parameter determines the index of the requested page. If not present the default value is 0
        showArchived - This optional parameter determines whether only the articles indexed after the user's last login should be shown or all articles matching the feeds filter. Defaults to false.
        session -
        Returns:
        The page showing the short form of the articles of the selected feed

      • showArticle

        @GetMapping(value="/*/article/{id}")
public java.lang.String showArticle(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth,
                                                                          @PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                          java.util.UUID articleId,
                                                                          org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Shows the long version of the requested article
        Parameters:
        auth -
        articleId - The article to show
        model -
        Returns:
        A page showing the details of the requested article

      • saveQuery

        private void saveQuery(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                       java.util.UUID feedId,
                       java.lang.Integer page,
                       java.lang.Boolean showArchived)
        Saves the given fields into the user's HttpSession. This allows for easy link backs to the feedOverview when accessing an individual Article in the Jack the Clipper application. The keys for each field can be found in Constants. Which parameter is saved under which key should be clear from naming.
        Parameters:
        session - The session to save the parameters in
        feedId - The id of the last visited feed
        page - The last page visited
        showArchived - Whether all articles relevant to this feed should be shown or only the most recent ones
